en: S.S. Barracks that housed troops who guarded Hitler's home

An image of the destroyed SS barracks in Berchtesgaden, Germany. The complex was destroyed in April, 1945 and razed in 1951. It contained barracks, a kitchen, a garage, a gymnasium and staff headquarters. The 101st airborne division was on the site during their search for members of the Nazi party after the war had ended.  The barracks housed troops that were guarding Hitler's home during the war.
Era 8 - The Great Depression and World War II (1929-1945)
